p: SARS-CoV-2 and HIV-1 belong to different virus classes, according to Baltimore classification [ 19]. Data on the homology between SARS-CoV-2 and HIV-1 are controversial [ 20]. Besides, they use different cells to replicate in the human body. HIV-1 uses the receptors CCR5 or CXCR4 to infect CD4 T cells [ 21, 22], while SARS-CoV-2 uses ACE2 to infect the cells of heart, lungs, kidneys, and gastrointestinal tract [ 23].
